explanation:
get_param_value: process_param__connections delegates parsing/validation to get_param_value. If any string comparisons are performed there (e.g. comparing param_name or param_tail to literals), they might use memcmp on null-terminated strings — you must inspect get_param_value's implementation to detect forbidden memcmp usage.

mhd_tool_str_to_uint: get_param_value calls mhd_tool_str_to_uint (per the static call graph). That callee could itself perform string comparisons (or call other helpers that do). Include it so you can examine all reachable code from get_param_value for memcmp usage on null-terminated strings.

memcmp: the Standard Library function whose use is restricted by the MISRA rule. You must locate every call site of memcmp in the above functions (and their callees) and check the operands to determine whether memcmp is being used to compare null-terminated strings.
